intro: Eschscholzia cyathifera, commonly known as the California poppy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its vibrant orange to red petals and a distinctive, cup-shaped yellow center. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and open woodlands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. The California poppy is a member of the Papaveraceae family and is known for its ecological importance as a nectar source for pollinators.
